creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
description: Brass kettle on a brass stand with four legs; round stretcher
image_copyright: Copyright of the artist%2C artist%27s estate%2C or assignees
text: The industrial character of Jan Eisenlöffel's metalwork held a strong appeal in pre-World War I Germany where certain advanced designers and manufacturers sought to develop designs for machinery and mass production. Today, he is best remembered for his various teakettle designs, this kettle-on-stand being one of them. It was intended to be placed at the side of the dining table facilitating the pouring of hot water without interrupting dinner.
title: Tea kettle on floor stand
